VARIABLES.description: Rudder pedal position.

Position (-16K to 0)
          -16K = left pedal pushed full in

VARIABLES.description: Percent rudder input deflection.

VARIABLES.name: RUDDER TRIM
VARIABLES.description: Angle deflection.

VARIABLES.name: RUDDER TRIM DISABLED
VARIABLES.description: Whether or not the Rudder Trim has been disabled.

VARIABLES.name: RUDDER TRIM PCT
VARIABLES.description: The trim position of the rudder. Zero is no trim.

VARIABLES.name: SPOILERS ARMED
VARIABLES.description: Checks if autospoilers are armed (true) or not (false).

VARIABLES.name: SPOILER AVAILABLE
VARIABLES.description: True if spoiler system available.

VARIABLES.name: SPOILERS HANDLE POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Spoiler handle position.
VARIABLES.units:
Percent Over 100
          or
          Position
          (16K = down, 0 = up)

VARIABLES.name: SPOILERS LEFT POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Percent left spoiler deflected.
VARIABLES.units:
Percent Over 100
          or
          Position
          (0 = retracted, 16K fully extended)

VARIABLES.name: SPOILERS RIGHT POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Percent right spoiler deflected.
VARIABLES.units:
Percent Over 100
          or
          Position (0 = retracted, 16K fully extended)

VARIABLES.name: BLAST SHIELD POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Indexed from 1, 100 is fully deployed, 0 flat on deck

VARIABLES.name: CABLE CAUGHT BY TAILHOOK
VARIABLES.description: A number 1 through 4 for the cable number caught by the tailhook. Cable 1 is the one closest to the stern of the carrier. A value of 0 indicates no cable was caught.

VARIABLES.name: CATAPULT STROKE POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Catapults are indexed from 1. This value will be 0 before the catapult fires, and then up to 100 as the aircraft is propelled down the catapult. The aircraft may takeoff before the value reaches 100 (depending on the aircraft weight, power applied, and other factors), in which case this value will not be further updated. This value could be used to drive a bogie animation.

VARIABLES.name: HOLDBACK BAR INSTALLED
VARIABLES.description: Holdback bars allow build up of thrust before takeoff from a catapult, and are installed by the deck crew of an aircraft carrier.

VARIABLES.name: LAUNCHBAR HELD EXTENDED
VARIABLES.description: This will be True if the launchbar is fully extended, and can be used, for example, to change the color of an instrument light.

VARIABLES.name: LAUNCHBAR POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Installed on aircraft before takeoff from a carrier catapult. Note that gear cannot retract with this extended. 100 = fully extended. Refer to the document Notes on Aircraft Systems.

VARIABLES.name: LAUNCHBAR SWITCH
VARIABLES.description: If this is set to True the launch bar switch has been engaged.

VARIABLES.name: NUMBER OF CATAPULTS
VARIABLES.description: Maximum of 4. A model can contain more than 4 catapults, but only the first four will be read and recognized by the simulation.

VARIABLES.name: CONCORDE NOSE ANGLE
VARIABLES.description: The nose angle, where 0 is fully up.

VARIABLES.name: CONCORDE VISOR NOSE HANDLE
VARIABLES.description: The visor nose handle position.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0:[index] visor up, nose down
            1:[index] visor down, nose up
            2:[index] visor down, nose 5 degrees
            3:[index] visor down, nose 12.5 degrees

VARIABLES.name: CONCORDE VISOR POSITION PERCENT
VARIABLES.description: The visor position expressed as a percentage where 0.0 = up and 1.0 = extended/down.

VARIABLES.name: BUS LOOKUP INDEX
VARIABLES.description:
This is a settable simvar meaning that it can both be read and set. Some of the simvars in this list are using this to lookup a value using two arguments (one argument in addition to the component index). For example to check the state of the connection between a "circuit.45" and the "bus.2" it would be written as follows:
          2 (>A:BUS LOOKUP INDEX, Number) (A:CIRCUIT CONNECTION ON:45, Bool)

VARIABLES.name: BUS BREAKER PULLED
VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the bus breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

VARIABLES.name: BUS CONNECTION ON
VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the bus is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a bus index.

VARIABLES.name: ELECTRICAL GENALT BUS VOLTAGE

VARIABLES.name: ELECTRICAL MAIN BUS VOLTAGE

VARIABLES.name: ELECTRICAL AVIONICS BUS VOLTAGE

VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the alternator breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and an alternator index.

VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the alternator is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and an alternator index.

VARIABLES.name: GENERAL ENG MASTER ALTERNATOR:index
VARIABLES.description: The alternator (generator) switch position, true if the switch is ON. Requires an engine index, and the use of an alternator index when referencing.

VARIABLES.description: Set or get whether an APU is active (true) or not (false). Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU.

VARIABLES.description: Enables or disables the APU for an engine. Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU

VARIABLES.description: The volts from the APU to the selected engine. Takes an index to be able to have multiple generators on a single APU.

VARIABLES.name: BLEED AIR APU
VARIABLES.description: Boolean, returns whether or not the APU attempts to provide Bleed Air.

VARIABLES.name: BATTERY BREAKER PULLED
VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the battery breaker is pulled. Requires a BUS LOOKUP INDEX and a battery index.

VARIABLES.name: BATTERY CONNECTION ON
VARIABLES.description: This will be true if the battery is connected. Requires a BUS_LOOKUP_INDEX and a battery index.

VARIABLES.description: Battery capacity over max capacity, 100 is full.

VARIABLES.description: The load handled by the battery (negative values mean the battery is receiving current). Use a battery index when referencing.

VARIABLES.description: The battery voltage. Use a battery index when referencing.

VARIABLES.name: GENERAL ENG HOBBS ELAPSED TIME:index

This can be used to find the time since the indexed engine (see note) started running. Similar to ElapsedTachometerTime, this records the time the engine has been running, but instead of taking a % of the time based on the Pct/RPM this takes the full time, but only if a threshold RPM/speed is reached. You can set the thresholds using the accumulated_time_hobbs_min_pct_rpm
          and accumulated_time_hobbs_min_knots parameters in the [GENERALENGINEDATA] section of the engine.cfg file.

VARIABLES.name: RECIP ENG EMERGENCY BOOST ELAPSED TIME:index
VARIABLES.description:
The elapsed time that emergency boost has been active on the indexed engine (see note). The timer will start when boost is first activated.
          IMPORTANT! This timer does not reset. So if you set your time limit in the engine.cfg file to 315s and you spend 2 minutes with boost active, then pull back on the throttle for 1 minute, then engage boost again for 2 minutes, the simulation will consider that you spent 4 minutes with boost active. The 1 minute pause is not taken into account.

VARIABLES.name: TURB ENG CONDITION LEVER POSITION:index
VARIABLES.description:
When the throttle is on idle position, this sets the condition levers to one of 3 positions to define the idle N1 target for the indexed engine (see note):
          
            Down position is the cut-off position that cuts the fuel to the engine, effectively shutting down the engine.
            Middle position requires N1 to reach the low idle value when throttle is in idle position (low idle value can be checked using the TURB_ENG_LOW_IDLE SimVar).
            High position requires N1 to reach the high idle value when throttle is in idle position (high idle value can be checked using the TURB_ENG_HIGH_IDLE SimVar).
          
          Note that this option requires several settings from the engines.cfg file to be set to specific values before working correctly:
          
            DisableMixtureControls needs to be set to 1 (TRUE).
            tp_idle_range should be set to 0 (since there is no mixture setting).
            idle_fuel_flow and idle_high_fuel_flow must be set to the same value (since there is no mixture setting to induce a variation between the 2).
            low_idle_n1 and high_idle_n1 to be correctly set.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0 = fuel cut-off
            1 = low idle
            2 = high idle

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN CRUISE ALT
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the optimal altitude the aircraft should maintain when in cruise. It is derived from the cruise_alt setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 1500ft.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPAWN ALTITUDE CRUISE
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the spawn altitude for the aircraft when spawning in cruise. It is derived from the spawn_cruise_altitude setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 1500ft.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPAWN ALTITUDE DESCENT
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the spawn altitude for the aircraft when spawning in descent. It is derived from the spawn_descent_altitude setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default is 500ft.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPEED CLIMB
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the optimal climb speed for the aircraft. It is derived from the climb_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is -1.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPEED MIN ROTATION
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the minimum speed required for aircraft rotation. It is derived from the rotation_speed_min setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is -1.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPEED VC
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the aircraft ideal cruising speed. It is derived from the cruise_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. The default value is computed an internal function that uses the estimated cruise altitude and estimated cruise percent power, according of the engine type, the number of engines, the density, the wing area and some drag parameters. Normally this value is set in the CFG file and the default value is never used.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPEED VS0
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the the stall speed when flaps are fully extended. It is derived from the full_flaps_stall_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is 0.8 x VS.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN SPEED VS1
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the stall speed when flaps are fully retracted. It is derived from the flaps_up_stall_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg. Default value is 0.

VARIABLES.name: DESIGN TAKEOFF SPEED
VARIABLES.description: This design constant represents the aircraft ideal takoff speed. It is derived from the takeoff_speed setting in the [REFERENCE SPEEDS] section of the flightmodel.cfg.

VARIABLES.name: FUEL SELECTED TRANSFER MODE
VARIABLES.description:
The method of transfer for the fuel. Each of the available transfer options are explained below:
          
            off - Fuel transfer is switched off.
            auto - Automatically balance the fuel between the Center1 and Center2 tanks to maintain the center of gravity.
            forward - Fuel will be transferred forwards from the Center1 tank to the Center2 tank.
            aft - Fuel will be transferred aftwards from the Center2 tank to the Center1 tank.
            manual - Fuel will be transferred for 1 second from the Center1 tank to the Center2 tank at a rate of 1lbs/s.  
            custom - This requires one or more pumps to have been defined using the fuel_transfer_pump.N parameter in the flight_model.cfg file, as well as their associated electrical circuits.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0 = off
            1 = auto
            2 = forward
            3 = aft
            4 = manual
            5 = custom

VARIABLES.name: SURFACE RELATIVE GROUND SPEED
VARIABLES.description: The speed of the aircraft relative to the speed of the first surface directly underneath it. Use this to retrieve, for example, an aircraft's taxiing speed while it is moving on a moving carrier. It also applies to airborne aircraft, for example when a helicopter is successfully hovering above a moving ship, this value should be zero. The returned value will be the same as GROUND VELOCITY if the first surface beneath it is not moving.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY DISTANCE
VARIABLES.description: This float represents the distance between the player's plane and the center of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY END DISTANCE
VARIABLES.description: This is a float corresponding to the horizontal distance between the player's plane and the end of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY HEADING DEGREES TRUE
VARIABLES.description: This float represents the true heading of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY LENGTH
VARIABLES.description: The length of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns -1 if no runway is assigned.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION X
VARIABLES.description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative X (transverse) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION Y
VARIABLES.description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Y (height) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY RELATIVE POSITION Z
VARIABLES.description: This is a float corresponding to the player's main gear relative Z (longitudinal) position on the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY SELECTED
VARIABLES.description: This is a boolean corresponding to whether or not the ATC has pre-selected a runway for the player's plane. If this is false, every other ATC_RUNWAY SimVar will return default values.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY START DISTANCE
VARIABLES.description: This is a float corresponding to the horizontal distance between the player's plane and the start of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION X
VARIABLES.description: This float represents the player's main gear relative X (transverse) position accorindg to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION Y
VARIABLES.description: This float represents the player's main gear relative Y (height) position accorindg to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY TDPOINT RELATIVE POSITION Z
VARIABLES.description: This float represents the player's main relative Z (longitudinal) position accorindg to the aiming point of the runway selected by the ATC.

VARIABLES.name: ATC RUNWAY WIDTH
VARIABLES.description: The width of the runway assigned by the ATC. Returns -1 if no runway is assigned.

VARIABLES.name: ATC SUGGESTED MIN RWY LANDING

VARIABLES.name: KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:index
VARIABLES.description:
The value for the given altimeter index in inches of mercury.
          IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING HG:2, etc...

VARIABLES.name: KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:index
VARIABLES.description:
The value for the given altimeter index in millibars.
          IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING MB:2, etc...

VARIABLES.name: KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:index
VARIABLES.description:
True if the indexed altimeter is in "Standard" mode, or false otherwise.
          IMPORTANT! In the system.cfg file, altimeters are indexed from 0, but the SimVar indexes from 1. So, altimeter 0 in that file is accessed using KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:1, 1 by KOHLSMAN SETTING STD:2, etc...

VARIABLES.description: Returns either the pitch (index 0) or the yaw (index 1) of the current gameplay camera.

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA REQUEST ACTION
VARIABLES.description: This can be used to have the currently active camera perform a predefined action. Currently only 1 action is supported, but more may be added over time.

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA STATE
VARIABLES.description:
This can be used to get or set the camera "state", which will be one of the listed enum values.
          Note that not ALL possible enum values are shown, since some values are internal only, and some values will do nothing, but have been reserved for future expansion of the camera system. 
          Also note that the value "8" is a special case, generally used only when working with in-sim panels and is used to go to the showcase cameras, defaulting to the last selected camera within this section (Drone, Fixed or Environment).
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            2 = Cockpit
            3 = External/Chase
            4 = Drone
            5 = Fixed on Plane
            6 = Environment
            8 = Showcase
            9 = Drone Plane
            11 = World Map
            12 = Hanger RTC
            13 = Menu RTC
            14 = In-Sim RTC
            18 = Hanger
            21 = Ground
            22 = Follow Air Traffic

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA SUBSTATE
VARIABLES.description: This variable can be used to get or set the camera "sub-state". The options here are generally only required when working with the in-sim panel UI. Note that the "locked" and "unlocked" state will be changed automatically if the following SimVars have their values changed: COCKPIT_CAMERA_HEADLOOK, CHASE_CAMERA_HEADLOOK.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            1 = Locked (Fixed look or chase lock -
                
                The camera is locked in position)
            2 = Unlocked (Head look or Chase
                
                normal - The camera is "attached" to
                
                the mouse)
            3 = Quickview (the camera is
                
                currently using a Quickview)
            4 = Smart (The camera has Smart
                
                camera active)
            5 = Instrument (The camera is
                
                focused on an instruments panel)

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX:index
VARIABLES.description:
With this you can get or set both the type of view for the current camera, as well as the option index, which will be between 0 and the maximum index value (as retrieved using the CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX SimVar). Supplying an index of 0 to the SimVar will get/set the type (from the selection of enum values listed), and using an index of 1 will get/set the option index, which is an integer value.
           
          Please see the Notes On View Types And Indices section below for more information.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum (index = 0):
          
            0 = Unknown/default
            (External / Chase and Showcase /
                
                Drone / Fixed / Environment states)
            1 = Pilot View
            (Cockpit State)
            2 = Instruments
            (Cockpit State)
            3 = Quickview
            (Cockpit State)
            4 = Quickview External
            (External State)
            5 = View
            (Showcase / Drone / Fixed /
                
                Environment states)
          
          or
          Number (index = 1)

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX:index
VARIABLES.description:
This variable can get the number of option indices related to a specific camera view type. The index value supplied to the SimVar should be one of the camera view type Enum values (see CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX), and the SimVar will return the number of options available for that camera type (counting from 1, so - for example - if the camera view type is "Quickview" and has 8 quickview settings, then CAMERA VIEW TYPE AND INDEX MAX:4 will return 8). Note that this value can be set after a flight has started, but it will have no effect since the number of camera options is initilaised once only and not updated (and the simulation may overwrite the value again even after setting it).
           
          Please see the Notes On View Types And Indices section below for more information.

VARIABLES.name: GAMEPLAY CAMERA FOCUS
VARIABLES.description:
This gets/sets the focus for the camera zoom, which can be either manual, or auto. The setting affects both the Cockpit and the External (Chase) cameras.
          The following SimVars can be used to get/set the level of zoom: COCKPIT_CAMERA_ZOOM or CHASE_CAMERA_ZOOM.

VARIABLES.name: CHASE CAMERA HEADLOOK
VARIABLES.description: This is used to get/set the look state of the chase (external) camera. Note that this value will also affect the CAMERA_SUBSTATE value, when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 3 (External/Chase).

VARIABLES.name: CHASE CAMERA MOMENTUM
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the momentum modifier of the chase (external) camera, which is controls how fast/slow the camera will stop moving when no longer being moved by the user. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: CHASE CAMERA SPEED
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the chase (external) camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: CHASE CAMERA ZOOM
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the chase (external) camera. Note that when setting this value, it will affect the camera regardless of whether the GAMEPLAY_CAMERA_FOCUS is set to manual or automatic. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: CHASE CAMERA ZOOM SPEED
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the speed modifier for when the zoom/FOV chase (external) camera changes zoom/FOV levels. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA ACTION COCKPIT VIEW RESET
VARIABLES.description: This can be used to reset the cockpit camera when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit). Essentially the same as the user pressing the default reset keys CTRL + Space.

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA ACTION COCKPIT VIEW SAVE:index
VARIABLES.description: This can be used to save a cockpit camera when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit). The index value given is the save "slot" that will be used, from 0 to 9. Essentially this is the same as the user pressing the default save keys CTRL + Alt + 0-9.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA HEADLOOK
VARIABLES.description: This is used to get/set the look state of the cockpit camera. Note that this value will also affect the CAMERA_SUBSTATE value, when the CAMERA_STATE is set to 2 (Cockpit).

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA HEIGHT
VARIABLES.description: This can be used to get/set the cockpit camera height modifier expressed as a percentage. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA INSTRUMENT AUTOSELECT
VARIABLES.description: This can be used to get or set the autoselect option for the cockpit camera when viewing the instruments (ie: the CAMERA_SUBSTATE is 5). When enabled the camera will move automatically if the player mouse reaches the edge of the screen and there are instrument panels available on that side.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA MOMENTUM
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the momentum modifier of the cockpit camera, which is controls how fast/slow the camera will stop moving when no longer being moved by the user. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA SIDE
VARIABLES.description: Not currently used in the simulation.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA SPEED
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the cockpit camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA UPPER POSITION
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the current "upper position" cockpit camera toggle. When 1 (TRUE), the camera is is in the upper position, and when 0 (FALSE) it is in the default position.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA ZOOM
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the cockpit camera. Note that when setting this value, it will affect the camera regardless of whether the GAMEPLAY_CAMERA_FOCUS is set to manual or automatic. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: COCKPIT CAMERA ZOOM SPEED
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the speed modifier for when the zoom/FOV cockpit camera changes zoom/FOV levels. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA FOCUS
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the focus modifier for the drone camera. Default is 50%, and a lower value will set the drone focus to things in the foreground and a higher level will set the drone focus to things in the background. Note that this is only taken into account when the DRONE_CAMERA_FOCUS_MODE is set to 3 (manual).

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA FOCUS MODE
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the current drone focus mode. When set to 3 (manual), the focus position will be based on the DRONE_CAMERA_FOCUS value.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA FOLLOW
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the whether the drone camera is in follow mode or not.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA FOV
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the zoom/FOV modifier for the drone camera. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA LOCKED
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the whether the drone camera is locked or not.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA SPEED ROTATION
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the rotation speed modifier of the drone camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: DRONE CAMERA SPEED TRAVELLING
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the translation speed modifier of the drone camara, as a percentage. Default is 50%.

VARIABLES.name: SMART CAMERA ACTIVE
VARIABLES.description: Sets/gets the whether the smart camera is active or not.

VARIABLES.name: SMART CAMERA INFO:index
VARIABLES.description:
Gets information on the smartcam system. The index sets what kind of information will be returned (or set):
          
            0 = Gets the number of smartcam targets in the smart camera list
            1 = Gets or sets the index of the currently selected smartcam target, counting from 0 (so index 0 is the first target in the list).

VARIABLES.name: SMART CAMERA LIST:index
VARIABLES.description: Retrieves the type of target for the indexed position in the smartcam list, counting from 0 (so index 0 is the first target in the list).
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0 = unknown POI
            1 = Follow POI
            2 = User POI
            3 = General POI
            4 = End OF Runway
            5 = Landing Runway
            6 = Flightpath
            7 = Object Interaction
            8 = Multiplayer OOI
            9 = Active Runway
            10 = Waypoint
            11 = Airport OOI
            12 = Flight Assistant Destination

VARIABLES.name: SMART CAMERA LIST DESCRIPTION:index
VARIABLES.description: This returns a localised string that represents the smartcam target specified by the given index. Indices count from 0 so index 0 is the first target in the list.

VARIABLES.name: ANIMATION DELTA TIME
VARIABLES.description: Difference of time between the current frame and the last frame where this SimObject has been animated

VARIABLES.name: ARTIFICIAL GROUND ELEVATION
VARIABLES.description: In case scenery is not loaded for AI planes, this variable can be used to set a default surface elevation.

VARIABLES.name: CATEGORY
VARIABLES.description:
One of the following:
          
            "Airplane",
            "Helicopter",
            "Boat",
            "GroundVehicle",
            "ControlTower",
            "SimpleObject",
            "Viewer"

VARIABLES.name: CRASH FLAG
VARIABLES.description: Flag value that indicates the cause of a crash.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0:[index] None
            2:[index] Mountain
            4:[index] General
            6:[index] Building
            8:[index] Splash
            10:[index] Gear up
            12:[index] Overstress
            14:[index] Building
            16:[index] Aircraft
            18:[index] Fuel Truck

VARIABLES.name: CRASH SEQUENCE
VARIABLES.description: The state of the crash event sequence.
VARIABLES.units:
Enum:
          
            0:[index] off
            1:[index] complete
            3:[index] reset
            4:[index] pause
            11:[index] start

VARIABLES.name: ENV_COCKPIT_INSULATION
VARIABLES.description: dB
VARIABLES.multiplayer: This game parameter allows you to set up RTPC for cockpit insulation in order to attenuate outside sounds. Game parameter values come from Insulation_ExitClosed & Insulation_ExitOpen values set in the AcousticParameters in the sound.xml.

VARIABLES.name: ENV_DOPPLERCENTS
VARIABLES.description: Pitch cent
VARIABLES.multiplayer: This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on physical based Doppler effect in true pitch cents. The Doppler effect is disabled in camera chase.

VARIABLES.name: ENV_ELEVATION_AGL
VARIABLES.description: meter
VARIABLES.multiplayer: This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on altitude above ground variable.

VARIABLES.name: ENV_MACH_CONE_DEGREE
VARIABLES.description: degree
VARIABLES.multiplayer: This Game parameter allows you to set up RTPC depending on the degree of the mach cone from 180° to 0°.

VARIABLES.name: ENV_MACH_CONE_ZONE
VARIABLES.description: boolean
VARIABLES.multiplayer:
This Game parameter allows you to set up RTPC depending on whether the listener is inside or outside the mach cone:
          
            0 = The listener (camera) is not in the mach cone zone
            1 = The listener (camera) is in the mach cone zone

VARIABLES.name: CAMERA_VIEWPOINT
VARIABLES.description: Boolean
VARIABLES.multiplayer:
This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on the camera ViewPoint:
          
          - 0 = camera inside
          
          - 1 = camera outside

VARIABLES.name: HEADPHONE_FILTER
VARIABLES.description: Boolean
VARIABLES.multiplayer:
This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on the headphone filter state:
          
          - 0 = headphone filter off
          
          - 1 = headphone filter on

VARIABLES.name: HEADPHONE_SWITCH
VARIABLES.description: Boolean
VARIABLES.multiplayer:
This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on how the headphone filter state:
          
          - 0 = headset switch off: headset not put
          
          - 1 = camera is in outside view
          
          - 1 = headphone filter is set to on
          
          - 1 = communication device is set to on

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_COCKPIT_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1
VARIABLES.multiplayer: Cockpit volume level. Includes sounds coming from cockpit such as instrument & avionic sounds, switch & lever foleys.

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_ENGINE_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_ENVIRONMENT_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1
VARIABLES.multiplayer: This game parameter allows to set up RTPC based on altitude above ground variable.

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_GLOBAL_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_INTERFACE_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_MISCELLANEOUS_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1
VARIABLES.multiplayer: Aircraft miscellaneous volume level. Includes diverse aircraft sounds such as flight controls, rattles, ground sounds, pumps, hydraulics, etc.

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_MUSIC_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_VOICE_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1

VARIABLES.name: MIXER_WARNING_VOLUME
VARIABLES.description: Value from 0 to 1
VARIABLES.multiplayer: Warning volume level. Includes stalls, aural , gpws, t-cas and autopilot warning sounds.

          Not currently supported in the simulation.

          Not currently supported in the simulation.

Increments elevator up
          Not currently supported in the simulation.

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to closest increment (-16383 - +16383)

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to first extension position

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to second extension position

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to third extension position

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to fourth extension position

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to full extension position

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to closest increment (0 to 16383)

EVENTS.description: Sets flap handle to full retract position

EVENTS.multiplayer:
Shared Cockpit
          (Pilot only, and not transmitted to Co-pilot)

EVENTS.name: SLEW_HEADING_MINUS
EVENTS.description: Increase slew heading to the left

EVENTS.name: SLEW_HEADING_PLUS
EVENTS.description: Increase slew heading to the right

EVENTS.name: SLEW_RESET
EVENTS.description: Stop slew and reset pitch, bank, and heading all to zero.

EVENTS.name: SPOILERS_OFF
EVENTS.description: Sets spoiler handle to full retract position

EVENTS.name: SPOILERS_ON
EVENTS.description: Sets spoiler handle to full extend position

EVENTS.name: ATTITUDE_BARS_POSITION_DOWN
EVENTS.description: Decrements attitude indicator pitch reference bars

EVENTS.name: ATTITUDE_BARS_POSITION_UP
EVENTS.description: Increments attitude indicator pitch reference bars

EVENTS.name: BAROMETRIC
EVENTS.description: Syncs altimeter setting to sea level pressure, or 29.92 if above 18000 feet

EVENTS.name: GAUGE_KEYSTROKE
EVENTS.description: Enables a keystroke to be sent to a gauge that is in focus. The keystrokes can only be in the range 0 to 9, A to Z, and the four keys: plus, minus, comma and period. This is typically used to allow some keyboard entry to a complex device such as a GPS to enter such things as ICAO codes using the keyboard, rather than turning dials.

EVENTS.name: HEADING_GYRO_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets heading indicator to 0 drift error.

EVENTS.name: RESET_G_FORCE_INDICATOR
EVENTS.description: Resets max/min indicated G force to 1.0.

EVENTS.name: RESET_MAX_RPM_INDICATOR
EVENTS.description: Reset max indicated engine rpm to 0.

EVENTS.name: ATTITUDE_CAGE_BUTTON
EVENTS.description: Cages attitude indicator at 0 pitch and bank

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_TURN_INDICATOR_SWITCH
EVENTS.description: Turn the turn indicator on or off.

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_VARIOMETER_SWITCH
EVENTS.description: Turn the variometer on or off.

EVENTS.name: TRUE_AIRSPEED_CAL_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements airspeed indicators true airspeed reference card

EVENTS.name: TRUE_AIRSPEED_CAL_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments airspeed indicators true airspeed reference card

EVENTS.name: TRUE_AIRSPEED_CAL_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets airspeed indicators true airspeed reference card (degrees, where 0 is standard sea level conditions)

EVENTS.name: ANTISKID_BRAKES_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn the anti-skid braking system on or off.

EVENTS.name: AXIS_LEFT_BRAKE_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets left brake position from axis controller (e.g. joystick). -16383 (0 braking) to +16383 (maximum braking)

EVENTS.name: AXIS_RIGHT_BRAKE_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets right brake position from axis controller (e.g. joystick). -16383 (0 braking) to +16383 (maximum braking)

EVENTS.name: GEAR_DOWN
EVENTS.description: Sets gear handle in DOWN position

EVENTS.name: GEAR_UP
EVENTS.description: Sets gear handle in UP position

EVENTS.name: RETRACT_FLOAT_SWITCH_DEC
EVENTS.description: If the plane has retractable floats, moves the retract position from Extend to Neutral, or Neutral to Retract.

EVENTS.name: RETRACT_FLOAT_SWITCH_INC
EVENTS.description: If the plane has retractable floats, moves the retract position from Retract to Neutral, or Neutral to Extend.

EVENTS.name: BLEED_AIR_SOURCE_CONTROL_INC
EVENTS.description: Increases the bleed air source control.

EVENTS.name: BLEED_AIR_SOURCE_CONTROL_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decreases the bleed air source control.

EVENTS.name: BLEED_AIR_SOURCE_CONTROL_SET
EVENTS.description: Set to one of: 0: auto1: off2: apu3: engines

EVENTS.name: CABIN_NO_SMOKING_ALERT_SWITCH_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn the "No smoking" alert on or off.

EVENTS.name: CABIN_SEATBELTS_ALERT_SWITCH_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn the "Fasten seatbelts" alert on or off.

EVENTS.name: EXTINGUISH_ENGINE_FIRE
EVENTS.description: Takes a two digit argument.The first digit represents the fire extinguisher index, and the second represents the engine index.For example, 11 would represent using bottle 1 on engine 1. 21 would represent using bottle 2 on engine 1. Typical entries for a twin engine aircraft would be 11 and 22.

EVENTS.name: HYDRAULIC_SWITCH_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn the hydraulic switch on or off.

EVENTS.name: RELEASE_DROPPABLE_OBJECTS
EVENTS.description: Release one dropable object. Multiple key events will release multiple objects.

EVENTS.name: TOW_PLANE_REQUEST
EVENTS.description: Request a tow plane. The user aircraft must be tow-able, stationary, on the ground and not already attached for this to succeed.

EVENTS.name: SET_TAIL_HOOK_HANDLE
EVENTS.description:
Sets the tail hook handle. Takes one of the following values:
          
            1 - set tail hook
            0 - retract tail hook

EVENTS.name: SET_WING_FOLD
EVENTS.description:
Sets the wings into the folded position suitable for storage, typically on a carrier. Takes one of the following values:
          
            1 -fold wings
            0 - unfold wings

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_AIRCRAFT_EXIT
EVENTS.description: Toggles primary door open/close. Usually follow by (for example) KEY_SELECT_2, etc... for subsequent doors.

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_WATER_BALLAST_VALVE
EVENTS.description: Turn the water ballast valve on or off.

EVENTS.name: TOW_PLANE_RELEASE
EVENTS.description: Release a towed aircraft, usually a glider.

EVENTS.name: KEY_TUG_HEADING
EVENTS.description: Triggers tug and sets the desired heading. The units are a 32 bit integer (0 to 4294967295) which represent 0 to 360 degrees. To set a 45 degree angle, for example, set the value to 4294967295 / 8.

EVENTS.name: KEY_TUG_SPEED
EVENTS.description: Triggers tug, and sets desired speed, in feet per second. The speed can be either positive (forward movement) or negative (backward movement).

EVENTS.name: PRESSURIZATION_PRESSURE_ALT_INC
EVENTS.description: Increases the altitude that the cabin is pressurized to.

EVENTS.name: PRESSURIZATION_PRESSURE_ALT_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decreases the altitude that the cabin is pressurized to.

EVENTS.name: PRESSURIZATION_CLIMB_RATE_INC
EVENTS.description: Sets the rate at which cabin pressurization is increased.

EVENTS.name: PRESSURIZATION_CLIMB_RATE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Sets the rate at which cabin pressurization is decreased.

EVENTS.name: PRESSURIZATION_PRESSURE_DUMP_SWTICH
EVENTS.description: Sets the cabin pressure to the outside air pressure.

EVENTS.name: STEERING_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments the nose wheel steering position by 5 percent.

EVENTS.name: STEERING_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements the nose wheel steering position by 5 percent.

EVENTS.name: STEERING_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the value of the nose wheel steering position. Zero is straight ahead(-16383, far left +16383, far right).

EVENTS.name: TAKEOFF_ASSIST_ARM_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Deploy or remove the assist arm. Refer to the document Notes on Aircraft Systems.

EVENTS.name: TAKEOFF_ASSIST_ARM_SET
EVENTS.description: Value: TRUE request set FALSE request unset

EVENTS.name: TAKEOFF_ASSIST_FIRE
EVENTS.description: If everything is set up correctly. Launch from the catapult.

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_LAUNCH_BAR_SWITCH
EVENTS.description: Toggle the request for the launch bar to be installed or removed.

EVENTS.name: SET_LAUNCH_BAR_SWITCH
EVENTS.description: Value: TRUE request set FALSE request unset

EVENTS.name: ROTOR_CLUTCH_SWITCH_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggles on electric rotor clutch switch

EVENTS.name: ROTOR_CLUTCH_SWITCH_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets electric rotor clutch switch on/off (1,0)

EVENTS.name: ROTOR_GOV_SWITCH_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggles the electric rotor governor switch

EVENTS.name: ROTOR_GOV_SWITCH_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the electric rotor governor switch on/off (1,0)

EVENTS.name: ROTOR_LATERAL_TRIM_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the lateral (right) rotor trim (0 to 16383)

EVENTS.name: SLING_PICKUP_RELEASE
EVENTS.description: Toggle between pickup and release mode. Hold mode is automatic and cannot be selected.

EVENTS.name: HOIST_SWITCH_EXTEND
EVENTS.description: The rate at which a hoist cable extends (set in the Aircraft Configuration File)

EVENTS.name: HOIST_SWITCH_RETRACT
EVENTS.description: The rate at which a hoist cable retracts (set in the Aircraft Configuration File).

EVENTS.name: HOIST_SWITCH_SET
EVENTS.description:
The hoist control switch setting. Should be set to one of the following values:
          
            <0 up
            0 off
            >0 down

EVENTS.name: HOIST_DEPLOY_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggles the hoist arm switch, extend or retract.

EVENTS.name: HOIST_DEPLOY_SET
EVENTS.description:
The hoist deployment setting. The value should be set to one of the following:
          
            0 - set hoist switch to retract the arm
            1 - set hoist switch to extend the arm

EVENTS.name: ADF
