EVENTS.description: Sets ADF 1 active frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrements ADF 1 frequency by 0.1 KHz, with carry

EVENTS.name: ADF_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increments ADF 1 frequency by 0.1 KHz, with carry

EVENTS.name: ADF_HIGHRANGE_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets ADF highrange frequency (BCD encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF_LOWRANGE_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets ADF lowrange frequency (BCD encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF_STBY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets ADF standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF1_WHOLE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements ADF 1 by 1 KHz, with carry as digits wrap.

EVENTS.name: ADF1_WHOLE_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments ADF 1 by 1 KHz, with carry as digits wrap.

EVENTS.name: ADF1_RADIO_SWAP
EVENTS.description: Swaps betweent the ADF 1 frequency and the Standby frequency.

EVENTS.name: ADF2_100_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements the ADF 2 frequency 100 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_10_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements the ADF 2 frequency 10 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_1_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements the ADF 2 frequency 1 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_100_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments the ADF 2 frequency 100 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_10_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments the ADF 2 frequency 10 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_1_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments the ADF 2 frequency 1 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_ACTIVE_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets ADF 2 active frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF2_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increments ADF 2 frequency by 0.1 KHz, with carry

EVENTS.name: ADF2_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrements ADF 2 frequency by 0.1 KHz, with carry

EVENTS.name: ADF2_RADIO_SWAP
EVENTS.description: Swaps betweent the ADF 2 frequency and the Standby frequency.

EVENTS.name: ADF2_RADIO_TENTHS_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments ADF 2 frequency 1/10 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_RADIO_TENTHS_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements ADF 2 frequency 1/10 digit, with wrapping

EVENTS.name: ADF2_STBY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets ADF 2 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: ADF2_WHOLE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements ADF 2 by 1 KHz, with carry as digits wrap.

EVENTS.name: ADF2_WHOLE_INC
EVENTS.description: Increments ADF 2 by 1 KHz, with carry as digits wrap.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the avionics master switch to on or off.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_1_ON
EVENTS.description: Sets avionics master 1 switch to on.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_1_OFF
EVENTS.description: Sets avionics master 1 switch to off.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_1_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets avionics master 1 switch to on or off.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_2_ON
EVENTS.description: Sets avionics master 2 switch to on.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_2_OFF
EVENTS.description: Sets avionics master 2 switch to off.

EVENTS.name: AVIONICS_MASTER_2_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the avionics 2 master switch to on or off.

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO
EVENTS.description: Sequentially selects the COM tuner digits for use with +/-. Follow by SELECT_2 for COM 2.

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_FRACT_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements COM 1 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 1 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_FRACT_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 1 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 1 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_STBY_RADIO_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 1 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: COM_STBY_RADIO_SWAP
EVENTS.description: Swaps COM 1 frequency with standby frequency.

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_WHOLE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 1 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_RADIO_WHOLE_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 1 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM_RECEIVE_ALL_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets whether to receive on all COM radios (1,0)

EVENTS.name: COM_RECEIVE_ALL_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggles all COM radios to receive on

EVENTS.name: COM1_STORED_FREQUENCY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 1 stored frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_FRACT_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 2 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 2 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_FRACT_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 2 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 2 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_WHOLE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 2 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_RADIO_WHOLE_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 2 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM2_STBY_RADIO_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 2 standby frequency (BCD encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: COM2_STORED_FREQUENCY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 2 stored frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_FRACT_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrements COM 3 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 3 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps.

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_FRACT_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 3 frequency by 25 KHz, with no carry when digit wraps.

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 3 frequency by 25 KHz, and carry when digit wraps.

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_WHOLE_DEC
EVENTS.description: Decrement COM 3 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM3_RADIO_WHOLE_INC
EVENTS.description: Increment COM 3 frequency by 1 MHz, with no carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: COM3_STBY_RADIO_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 3 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: COM3_STORED_FREQUENCY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets COM 3 stored frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: DME
EVENTS.description: Selects the DME for use with +/-

EVENTS.name: DME_SELECT
EVENTS.description: Selects one of the two DME systems (1,2).

EVENTS.name: RADIO_SELECTED_DME_IDENT_ENABLE
EVENTS.description: Turns on the identification sound for the selected DME.

EVENTS.name: RADIO_SELECTED_DME_IDENT_DISABLE
EVENTS.description: Turns off the identification sound for the selected DME.

EVENTS.name: RADIO_SELECTED_DME_IDENT_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the DME identification sound to the given filename.

EVENTS.name: RADIO_SELECTED_DME_IDENT_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turns on or off the identification sound for the selected DME.

EVENTS.name: GPS_CLEAR_BUTTON
EVENTS.description: Clears entered data on a page

EVENTS.name: GPS_CLEAR_BUTTON_DOWN
EVENTS.description: Triggers the pressing of the Clear button

EVENTS.name: GPS_CLEAR_BUTTON_UP
EVENTS.description: Triggers the release of the Clear button.

EVENTS.name: GPS_MENU_BUTTON
EVENTS.description: Brings up page to select active legs in a flightplan.

EVENTS.name: GPS_MSG_BUTTON_DOWN
EVENTS.description: Triggers the pressing of the message button.

EVENTS.name: GPS_MSG_BUTTON_UP
EVENTS.description: Triggers the release of the message button

EVENTS.name: GPS_TERRAIN_BUTTON
EVENTS.description: Displays terrain information on default display

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_GPS_DRIVES_NAV1
EVENTS.description: Toggles between GPS and NAV 1 driving NAV 1 OBS display (and AP)

EVENTS.name: FREQUENCY_SWAP
EVENTS.description: Swaps frequency with standby on whichever NAV or COM radio is selected.

EVENTS.name: MARKER_SOUND_SET
EVENTS.description:
Sets marker beacon sound (1, 0).
          Not currently used in the simulation.

EVENTS.name: NAV_RADIO
EVENTS.description: Sequentially selects the NAV tuner digits for use with +/-. Follow by SELECT_2 for NAV 2.

EVENTS.name: NAV1_RADIO_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrement NAV 1 frequency by 50 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: NAV1_RADIO_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increment NAV 1 frequency by 50 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: NAV1_STBY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets NAV 1 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: NAV2_RADIO_FRACT_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrement NAV 2 frequency by 50 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: NAV2_RADIO_FRACT_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increment NAV 2 frequency by 50 KHz, and carry when digit wraps

EVENTS.name: NAV2_STBY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets NAV 2 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: NAV3_STBY_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets NAV 3 standby frequency (BCD16 encoded Hz)

EVENTS.name: NAV3_RADIO_SWAP
EVENTS.description: Swap between NAV 3 frequency and the standby frequency.

EVENTS.name: VOR_OBS
EVENTS.description: Sequentially selects the VOR OBS for use with +/-. Follow by KEY_SELECT_2 for VOR 2.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR
EVENTS.description: Sequentially selects the transponder digits for use with +/-.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_DEC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Decrements fourth digit of transponder, and with carry.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_INC_CARRY
EVENTS.description: Increments fourth digit of transponder, and with carry.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_IDENT_OFF
EVENTS.description: Disable the transponder Ident (can be used along with the simvar TRANSPONDER_IDENT).

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_IDENT_ON
EVENTS.description: Enable the transponder Ident (can be used along with the simvar TRANSPONDER_IDENT). After 18 seconds it will disable automatically.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_IDENT_SET
EVENTS.description: Set the transponder Ident on or off (can be used along with the simvar TRANSPONDER_IDENT). If set to on, it will switch off automatically after 18 seconds.

EVENTS.name: XPNDR_IDENT_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle the transponder Ident from on to off or off to on (can be used along with the simvar TRANSPONDER_IDENT).

EVENTS.name: CROSS_FEED_OPEN
EVENTS.description: Opens cross feed valve (when used in conjunction with "isolate" tank)

EVENTS.name: CROSS_FEED_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggles crossfeed valve (when used in conjunction with "isolate" tank)

EVENTS.name: CROSS_FEED_OFF
EVENTS.description: Closes crossfeed valve (when used in conjunction with "isolate" tank)

EVENTS.name: CROSS_FEED_LEFT_TO_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel crossfeed to be from left to right.

EVENTS.name: CROSS_FEED_RIGHT_TO_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel crossfeed to be from right to left.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 2 to LEFT position (fuel will be retrieved from Left Tip then Left Aux then Left Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_LEFT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 2 to LEFT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_LEFT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 2 to the left Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 2 to RIGHT position (fuel will be retrieved from Right Tip then Right Aux then Right Main)

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_RIGHT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 2 to RIGHT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_RIGHT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 2 to the right Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_2_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets selector 2 position (see the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct code to use).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 3 to LEFT position (fuel will be retrieved from Left Tip then Left Aux then Left Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_LEFT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 3 to LEFT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_LEFT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 3 to the left Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 3 to RIGHT position (fuel will be retrieved from Right Tip then Right Aux then Right Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_RIGHT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 3 to RIGHT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_RIGHT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 3 to the right Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_3_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets selector 3 position (see the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct code to use).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 4 to LEFT position (fuel will be retrieved from Left Tip then Left Aux then Left Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_LEFT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 4 to LEFT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_LEFT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 4 to the left Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 4 to RIGHT position (fuel will be retrieved from Right Tip then Right Aux then Right Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_RIGHT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 4 to RIGHT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_RIGHT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 4 to the right Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_4_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets selector 4 position (see the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct code to use).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_ALL
EVENTS.description: Turn fuel selector 1 to the ALL position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 1 to LEFT position (fuel will be retrieved from Left Tip then Left Aux then Left Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_LEFT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 1 to LEFT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_LEFT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 1 to the left Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_OFF
EVENTS.description: Turn fuel selector 1 to the OFF position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 1 to RIGHT position (fuel will be retrieved from Right Tip then Right Aux then Right Main).

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_RIGHT_AUX
EVENTS.description: Turns selector 1 to RIGHT AUX position.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_RIGHT_MAIN
EVENTS.description: Sets the fuel selector for engine 1 to the right Main tank.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_SELECTOR_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets selector 1 position (see the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct code to use).

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_JUNCTION_SET
EVENTS.description: Set the current junction options for which lines are open or closed at any given time. This event requires two parameters: the first is the index of the junction (as defined by the N index of the Junction.N parameter), and the second is the Option index, which is what sets the lines to open/close.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_PUMP_OFF
EVENTS.description: Turn a fuel pump off. The event requires the N index of the Pump.N parameter to define the pump to use.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_PUMP_ON
EVENTS.description: Turn a fuel pump on. The event requires the N index of the Pump.N parameter to define the pump to use.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_PUMP_SET
EVENTS.description: Set a fuel pump to be either on or off. The event requires the N index of the Pump.N parameter to define the pump to use.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_PUMP_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle a fuel pump on/off. The event requires the N index of the Pump.N parameter to define the pump to use.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_TRIGGER_OFF
EVENTS.description: Turn a trigger event off. The event requires the N index of the Trigger.N parameter to define the trigger to switch off.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_TRIGGER_ON
EVENTS.description: Turn a trigger event on. The event requires the N index of the Trigger.N parameter to define the trigger to switch on.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_TRIGGER_SET
EVENTS.description: Set a trigger event to be either on or off. The event requires the N index of the Trigger.N parameter to define the trigger to set.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_TRIGGER_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle a trigger event on/off. The event requires the N index of the Trigger.N parameter to define the trigger to toggle.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_VALVE_CLOSE
EVENTS.description: Close a specific valve in the fuel system. The event requires the N index of the Valve.N parameter to define the valve to target.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_VALVE_OPEN
EVENTS.description: Open a specific valve in the fuel system. The event requires the N index of the Valve.N parameter to define the valve to target.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_VALVE_SET
EVENTS.description: Set a valve to be either open or closed. The event requires the N index of the Valve.N parameter to define the valve to target.

EVENTS.name: FUELSYSTEM_VALVE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle a valve open/closed. The event requires the N index of the Valve.N parameter to define the valve to target.

EVENTS.name: SET_FUEL_TRANSFER_CUSTOM
EVENTS.description: Set the fuel transfer mode to the "custom" setting. Requires that at least 1 transfer pump has been defined in the flight_model.cfg file using the fuel_transfer_pump.N parameter.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_TRANSFER_CUSTOM_INDEX_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle a custom fuel transfer pump on/off. The index is the Pump ID value supplied as part of the fuel pump definition for the fuel_transfer_pump.N parameter in the flight_model.cfg file.

EVENTS.name: SET_FUEL_TRANSFER_FORWARD
EVENTS.description: Set the fuel transfer system to use the "forward" setting, which pumps from tank 1 to tank 2.

EVENTS.name: SET_FUEL_TRANSFER_AFT
EVENTS.description: Set the fuel transfer system to use the "aft" setting, which pumps from tank 2 to tank 1.

EVENTS.name: SET_FUEL_TRANSFER_AUTO
EVENTS.description: Set the fuel transfer pump to automatically balance the fuel in tanks 1 and 2 to maintain the CG.

EVENTS.name: SET_FUEL_TRANSFER_OFF
EVENTS.description: Set the fuel transfer pump to off.

EVENTS.name: ADD_FUEL_QUANTITY
EVENTS.description: Adds fuel to the aircraft, 25% of capacity by default. 0 to 65535 (max fuel) can be passed.

EVENTS.name: ELECT_FUEL_PUMP1_SET
EVENTS.description:
Set the electrical pump status for engines 1-4. Values are as follows:
          
            0 = Off
            1 = On
            2 = Auto
          
          These keys are only useful when using the legacy [FUEL] system.

EVENTS.name: ENGINE_FUELFLOW_BUG_POSITION1
EVENTS.description: Not currently used in the simulation.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_DUMP_SWITCH_SET
EVENTS.description:
Set to 1 (TRUE) or 0 (FALSE). The switch can only be set to TRUE if fuel_dump_rate is specified in the aircraft configuration file, indicating that a fuel dump system exists.
          This key is only useful when using the legacy [FUEL] system.

EVENTS.name: FUEL_DUMP_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description:
Used to turn on (1, TRUE) or off (0, FALSE) the fuel dump switch.
          This key is only useful when using the legacy [FUEL] system.

EVENTS.name: MANUAL_FUEL_PRESSURE_PUMP
EVENTS.description: Activate the manual fuel pressure pump. Used for both modern [FUEL_SYSTEM] and legacy [FUEL] systems.

EVENTS.name: MANUAL_FUEL_PRESSURE_PUMP_SET
EVENTS.description: Set the position of the fuel manual pump handle, as a percentage. This key is only useful when using the modern [FUEL_SYSTEM].

EVENTS.name: MANUAL_FUEL_TRANSFER
EVENTS.description: When set to 1 (TRUE) it sets the fuel transfer mode to manual.

EVENTS.name: RELEASE_DROP_TANK_ALL
EVENTS.description: Release all external tanks that can be jettisoned.

EVENTS.name: RELEASE_DROP_TANK_1
EVENTS.description: Release the first external tank that can be jettisoned.

EVENTS.name: RELEASE_DROP_TANK_2
EVENTS.description: Release the second external tank that can be jettisoned.

EVENTS.name: REPAIR_AND_REFUEL
EVENTS.description: Fully repair and refuel the user aircraft. Ignored if flight realism is enforced.

EVENTS.name: REQUEST_FUEL_KEY
EVENTS.description: Request a fuel truck. The aircraft must be in a parking spot for this to be successful.

EVENTS.name: ANTIDETONATION_TANK_VALVE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle the anti-detonation valve. Pass a value to determine which tank to use if there are multiple tanks. See the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct tank code to use. Note that this key requires the [ANTIDETONATION_SYSTEM.N] system to have been set up in the engine configuration file.

EVENTS.name: NITROUS_TANK_VALVE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Toggle the nitrous valve. Pass a value to determine which tank to use if there are multiple tanks. See the Fuel Selector Codes list for the correct tank code to use. Note that this key requires the [NITROUS_SYSTEM.N] system to have been set up in the engine configuration file.

EVENTS.name: CAPTURE_SCREENSHOT
EVENTS.description: Capture the current view as a screenshot. Which will be saved to a bmp file in: My Documents\Pictures\

EVENTS.name: RELOAD_USER_AIRCRAFT
EVENTS.description: Reloads the user aircraft data (from cache if same type loaded as an AI,otherwise from disk)

EVENTS.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_SET
EVENTS.description: Generic key event to set a number value.

EVENTS.name: EXTERNAL_SYSTEM_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Generic key event to toggle a value on/off (true/false).

EVENTS.name: MINUS
EVENTS.description: Used in conjunction with "selected" parameters to decrease their value (e.g.,radio frequency)

EVENTS.name: MOUSE_LOOK_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Switch Mouse Look mode on or off. Mouse Look mode enables a user to control their view using the mouse, and holding down the space bar.

EVENTS.name: PLUS
EVENTS.description: Used in conjunction with "selected" parameters to increase their value (e.g.,radio frequency)

EVENTS.name: READOUTS_SLEW
EVENTS.description: Cycle through information readouts while in slew

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_AIRPORT_NAME_DISPLAY
EVENTS.description: Turn on or off the airport name.

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_JETWAY
EVENTS.description: Requests a jetway, which will only be answered if the aircraft is at a parking spot.

EVENTS.name: VIDEO_RECORD_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn on or off the video recording feature. This records uncompressed AVI format files to: My Documents\Videos\

EVENTS.name: VIEW_WINDOW_TITLES_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turn window titles on or off.

EVENTS.name: YAXIS_INVERT_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Switch inversion of Y axis controls on or off.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_LATITUDE_LONGITUDE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turns the freezing of the lat/lon position of the aircraft (either user or AI controlled) on or off. If this key event is set, it means that the latitude and longitude of the aircraft are not being controlled by ESP, so enabling, for example, a SimConnect client to control the position of the aircraft. This can also apply to altitude and attitude. Refer to the simulation variables: IS LATITUDE LONGITUDE FREEZE ON, IS ALTITUDE FREEZE ON, and IS ATTITUDE FREEZE ON Refer also to the SimConnect_AIReleaseControl function.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_LATITUDE_LONGITUDE_SET
EVENTS.description: Freezes the lat/lon position of the aircraft.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_ALTITUDE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turns the freezing of the altitude of the aircraft on or off.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_ALTITUDE_SET
EVENTS.description: Freezes the altitude of the aircraft.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_ATTITUDE_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turns the freezing of the attitude (pitch, bank and heading) of the aircraft on or off.

EVENTS.name: FREEZE_ATTITUDE_SET
EVENTS.description: Freezes the attitude (pitch, bank and heading) of the aircraft.

EVENTS.name: POINT_OF_INTEREST_TOGGLE_POINTER
EVENTS.description: Turn the point-of-interest indicator (often a light beam) on or off. Refer to the Missions system documentation.

EVENTS.name: POINT_OF_INTEREST_CYCLE_PREVIOUS
EVENTS.description: Change the current point-of-interest to the previous point-of-interest.

EVENTS.name: POINT_OF_INTEREST_CYCLE_NEXT
EVENTS.description: Change the current point-of-interest to the next point-of-interest.

EVENTS.name: MP_TRANSFER_CONTROL
EVENTS.description: Toggle to the next player to track

EVENTS.name: MP_PLAYER_CYCLE
EVENTS.description: Cycle through the current user aircraft.

EVENTS.name: MP_PLAYER_FOLLOW
EVENTS.description: Set the view to follow the selected user aircraft.

EVENTS.name: MP_VOICE_CAPTURE_START
EVENTS.description: Start capturing audio from the users computer and transmitting it to all other players in the multiplayer session who are turned to the same radio frequency.

EVENTS.name: MP_BROADCAST_VOICE_CAPTURE_START
EVENTS.description: Start capturing audio from the users computer and transmitting it to all other players in the multiplayer session.

EVENTS.name: TOGGLE_RACERESULTS_WINDOW
EVENTS.description: Show or hide multi-player race results.

EVENTS.name: SIM_RATE
EVENTS.description: Selects the simulation rate. Use the PLUS and MINUS events to increment/decrement the value.

EVENTS.name: SIM_RATE_DECR
EVENTS.description: Decreases the simulation rate, which will slow down the in-simulation time.

EVENTS.name: SIM_RATE_INCR
EVENTS.description: Increase the simulation rate, which will speed up the in-simulation time.

EVENTS.name: AXIS_PAN_PITCH
EVENTS.description: Sets the pitch of the camera axis. Requires an angle.

EVENTS.name: AXIS_PAN_HEADING
EVENTS.description: Sets the heading of the axis. Requires an angle.

EVENTS.name: AXIS_PAN_TILT
EVENTS.description: Sets the tilt of the axis. Requires an angle.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_CHASE_DISTANCE_ADD
EVENTS.description: Increments the distance of the view camera from the chase object (such as in Spot Plane view, or viewing an AI controlled aircraft).

EVENTS.name: VIEW_CHASE_DISTANCE_SUB
EVENTS.description: Decrements the distance of the view camera from the chase object.

EVENTS.name: MAP_ZOOM_FINE_OUT
EVENTS.description: Fine zoom out in map view

EVENTS.name: VIEW_COCKPIT_FORWARD
EVENTS.description: Switch immediately to the forward view, in 2D mode.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_FORWARD_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction forward and left

EVENTS.name: VIEW_FORWARD_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction forward and right

EVENTS.name: VIEW_FORWARD_RIGHT_UP
EVENTS.description: Sets view forward, right, and up

EVENTS.name: VIEW_FORWARD_LEFT_UP
EVENTS.description: Sets view forward left and up

EVENTS.name: VIEW_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction to the left

EVENTS.name: VIEW_LINKING_SET
EVENTS.description: Links all the views from one camera together, so that panning the view will change the view of all the linked cameras.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_LINKING_TOGGLE
EVENTS.description: Turns view linking on or off.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_PANEL_ALPHA_SELECT
EVENTS.description: Sets the mode to change the alpha-blending, so the keys KEY_PLUS and KEY_MINUS increment and decrement the value.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_PANEL_ALPHA_SET
EVENTS.description: Sets the alpha-blending value for the panel. Takes a parameter in the range 0to 255. The alpha-blending can be changed from the keyboard using Ctrl-Shift-T,and the plus and minus keys.

EVENTS.name: VIEW_REAR
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction to the rear

EVENTS.name: VIEW_REAR_LEFT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction to the rear and left

EVENTS.name: VIEW_REAR_LEFT_UP
EVENTS.description: Sets view rear left and up

EVENTS.name: VIEW_REAR_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction to the rear and right

EVENTS.name: VIEW_REAR_RIGHT_UP
EVENTS.description: Sets view rear, right, and up

EVENTS.name: VIEW_RESET
EVENTS.description: Resets the view to the default

EVENTS.name: VIEW_RIGHT
EVENTS.description: Sets view direction to the right

EVENTS.name: VIEW_VIRTUAL_COCKPIT_FORWARD
EVENTS.description: Switch immediately to the forward view, in virtual cockpit mode.

EVENTS.name: PAN_RESET_COCKPIT
EVENTS.description: Reset panning to forward, if in cockpit view

UNITS.name: meter, meters, m
UNITS.description: The meter is the base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI). 1m is equal to 3.28084 imperial feet.

UNITS.name: meter scaler 256
UNITS.description: This is the same as the meter (above) only scaled by 1/256, ie: VALUE / 256.

UNITS.name: millimeter, millimeters
UNITS.description: The millimeter is an SI unit of length, equal to one thousandth of a meter. 1mm is equal to 0.0393701 inches.

UNITS.name: centimeter, centimeters, cm
UNITS.description: A centimeter is an SI unit of length, equal to one hundredth of a meter. 1cm is equal to 0.393701 imperial inches.

UNITS.name: kilometer, kilometers, km
UNITS.description: The kilometer is an SI unit of length, equal to one thousand meters. 1km is equal to 0.621371 imperial miles.

UNITS.name: nautical mile, nautical miles, nmile, nmiles
UNITS.description: A nautical mile is a unit of length used in air and marine navigation. The nautical mile is defined as exactly 1852 meters (6076 ft or 1.151 miles).

UNITS.name: decinmile, decinmiles
UNITS.description: This is one tenth of a nautical mile, equivalent to 185.2 meters (607.61 ft).

UNITS.name: inch, inches, in
UNITS.description: The inch is an imperial unit of length derived as 1/12th of a foot. It is equal to 25.4 mm.

UNITS.name: foot, feet, ft
UNITS.description: The foot is an imperial unit of length, considered as 12 inches in length. It is equal to  0.3048 meters.

UNITS.name: yard, yards
UNITS.description: The yard is an imperial unit of length that comprises 3 feet or 36 inches, and 1,760 yards is equal to 1 mile. It is equal to 0.9144 meters.

UNITS.name: decimile, decimiles
UNITS.description: This is one tenth of an imperial mile, equivalent to 160.93 meters.

UNITS.name: mile, miles
UNITS.description: The mile is an imperial unit of length, equivalent to 1,609.34 meters.

UNITS.name: square inch, square inches, sq in, in2
UNITS.description: A square inch is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one inch. It is equal to 6.4516cm2.

UNITS.name: square feet, square foot, sq ft, ft2
UNITS.description: A square foot is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one foot. It is equal to 929.03cm2 or 144in2.

UNITS.name: square yard, square yards, sq yd, yd2
UNITS.description: A square yard is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one yard. It is equal to 0.83612736m2 or 9ft2.

UNITS.name: square mile, square miles
UNITS.description: A square mile is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one mile. It is equal to 2.58999km2.

UNITS.name: square millimeter, square millimeters, sq mm, mm2
UNITS.description: A square millimeter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one millimeter. It is equal to 0.0393701in2.

UNITS.name: square centimeter, square centimeters, sq cm, cm2
UNITS.description: A square centimeter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one centimeter. It is equal to 0.155in2.

UNITS.name: square meter, square meters, sq m, m2
UNITS.description: A square meter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one meter. It is equal to 10.7639ft2.

UNITS.name: square kilometer, square kilometers, sq km, km2
UNITS.description: A square kilometer is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a square with sides of one kilometer. It is equal to 0.386102miles2.

UNITS.name: cubic inch, cubic inches, cu in, in3
UNITS.description: A cubic inch is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one inch. It is equal to 16.3871cm3.

UNITS.name: cubic foot, cubic feet, cu ft, ft3
UNITS.description: A cubic foot is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one foot. It is equal to 28316.917cm3 or 1728.01in3.

UNITS.name: cubic yard, cubic yards, cu yd, yd3
UNITS.description: A cubic yard is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one yard. It is equal to 0.764555m3 or 27ft3.

UNITS.name: cubic mile, cubic miles
UNITS.description: A cubic mile is an imperial unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one mile. It is equal to 4.16818km3.

UNITS.name: cubic millimeter, cubic millimeters, cu mm, mm3
UNITS.description: A cubic millimeter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one millimeter.

UNITS.name: cubic centimeter, cubic centimeters, cu cm, cm3
UNITS.description: A cubic centimeter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one centimeter. It is equal to 0.0610237in3.

UNITS.name: cubic meter, cubic meters, meter cubed, meters cubed, cu m, m3
UNITS.description: A cubic meter is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one meter. It is equal to 35.3147ft3.

UNITS.name: cubic kilometer, cubic kilometers, cu km, km3
UNITS.description: A cubic kilometer is an SI unit of area, equal to the area of a cube with sides of one kilometer. It is equal to 0.239913miles3.

UNITS.name: liter, liters
UNITS.description: The liter is an SI unit of volume based on the mass of one kilogram of liquid water. It is equal to 0.264172gallons.

UNITS.name: gallon, gallons
UNITS.description: The gallon is an imperial unit of volume, defined as 231in3. It is equal to 3.785412 litres.

UNITS.name: quart, quarts
UNITS.description: The quart is an imperial unit of volume defined as 1 quarter of a gallon, or 57.75in3. It is equal to 0.946353 litres.

UNITS.name: fs7 oil quantity
UNITS.description: This is an imperial unit derived from quarts and gallons and only used when dealing with engine oil amounts. The formula used to derive the unit is: VALUE * ((8 / 32767) * (0.25 * (3.785411784 * 0.001)))

UNITS.name: kelvin
UNITS.description: The kelvin is the base unit of temperature in the International System of Units (SI). The kelvin is the primary unit of temperature measurement for the physical sciences, but is often used in conjunction with the degree Celsius - which has the same magnitude - where 0 kelvin (called "Absolute Zero") corresponds to a temperature of -273.15°C. "Absolute Zero" is the equivalent -459.67°F.

UNITS.name: rankine
UNITS.description: The rankine is a base unit of temperature, similar to the kelvin as 0 rankine is the same as "Absolute Zero" kelvin. However the difference of 1 rankine is defined as equal to 1 Fahrenheit degree, rather than the Celsius degree used on the kelvin scale. A temperature of 0K is equal to 0R which is the equivalent of -273.15°C or -459.67°F.

UNITS.name: farenheit, fahrenheit
UNITS.description: The Fahrenheit scale is a temperature scale based on two fixed points: the temperature at which pure water ice melts (32°F) and the temperature at which water boils (212°F) both at sea level and under standard atmospheric pressure. 0°F is equal to 255.372K, 459.67R or -17.7778°C.

UNITS.name: celsius
UNITS.description: The Celsius scale is a temperature scale based on 0°C for the freezing point of water and 100 °C for the boiling point of water at 1 atmosphere of pressure. 0°C is equal to 273.15K, 491.67R or 32°F

UNITS.name: celsius fs7 egt
UNITS.description: This the same as the celsius unit only scaled by the following formula: VALUE / (1.8 * (6144 / 2060)).

UNITS.name: celsius fs7 oil temp
UNITS.description: This the same as the celsius unit only scaled by the following formula: (VALUE - 273.15) * (16384 / 140.0). It is only used when dealing with engine oil temperature.

UNITS.name: celsius scaler 1/256
UNITS.description: This unit is for degrees celsius scaled by 1/256, eg: VALUE / 256.

UNITS.name: celsius scaler 256
UNITS.description: This unit is for degrees celsius scaled by 256, eg: VALUE * 256.

UNITS.name: celsius scaler 16k
UNITS.description: This unit is for degrees celsius scaled by 16K, eg: VALUE * 16384.0.

UNITS.name: radian, radians
UNITS.description: The radian is the base unit of temperature in the International System of Units (SI). One radian is defined as the angle subtended from the center of a circle which intercepts an arc equal in length to the radius of the circle. 1 radian is equivalent to 57.296°.

UNITS.name: round, rounds
UNITS.description: A round is defined as an angle of the full 360 degrees (ie: a circle).

UNITS.name: degree, degrees, Degrees
UNITS.description: The degree (°) is a base unit of angle defined such that an entire rotation is 360 degrees. 1° is equal to 0.0174533 radians.

UNITS.name: grad, grads
UNITS.description: The grad (or gradian) is a unit of measurement of an angle, defined as one hundredth of the right angle. 1 grad is equal to 90°, or 1.5708 radians.

UNITS.name: angl16
UNITS.description: This represents a unit that is a radian cast as a 16bit integer using the following formula: round(VALUE) / 65536.0

UNITS.name: angl32
UNITS.description: This represents a unit that is a radian cast as a 32bit integer using the following formula: round(VALUE) / (65536.0 * 65536.0)

UNITS.name: degree latitude, degrees latitude
UNITS.description: A degree latitude is an angle used to measure the geographic position along the North-South axis of the Earth, over it's surface. Degrees latitude range from 0° at the Equator to +90° at the North pole or -90° at the South pole.

UNITS.name: degree longitude, degrees longitude
UNITS.description: A degree longitude is an angle used to measure the geographic position along the East-West axis of the Earth, over it's surface. Degrees longitude range from 0° at the Prime Meridian to +180° Eastward and -180° Westward.

UNITS.name: meter latitude, meters latitude
UNITS.description: A meter latitude is defined as the number of degrees travelled for a meter of circumferance of the Earth. Essentially this equals meters * (360 / 40007000).

UNITS.name: radian per second, radians per second
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number of radians that something will rotate for every second of time that passes.

UNITS.name: revolution per minute, revolutions per minute, rpm, rpms
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number of full revolutions that something will complete for every minute of time that passes. A revolution is considered as a rotation of 360°.

UNITS.name: rpm 1 over 16k
UNITS.description: This is the same as the rpm unit, only scaled by 16K using the formula: VALUE / 16384.0

UNITS.name: minute per round, minutes per round
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number minutes that something will require for to complete a full round. A round is considered as a rotation of 360°.

UNITS.name: nice minute per round, nice minutes per round
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number minutes that something will require for to complete a full round. A round is considered as a rotation of 360°.

UNITS.name: degree per second, degrees per second
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number of degrees that something will rotate for every second of time that passes.

UNITS.name: degree per second ang16
UNITS.description: This is a unit of measurement that defines the number of degrees that something will rotate for every second of time that passes. The value is cast as a 16bit integer using the following formula: round(VALUE) / 65536.0

UNITS.name: radian per second squared, radians per second squared
UNITS.description: This is the unit of angular (rotational) acceleration magnitude in the International System of Units (SI). Essentially it is the rate of change of angular speed or velocity by one radian per second during a one second period.

UNITS.name: degree per second squared, degrees per second squared
UNITS.description: This is a unit of angular (rotational) acceleration magnitude. Essentially it is the rate of change of angular speed or velocity by one degree per second during a one second period.

UNITS.name: meter per second, meters/second, m/s
UNITS.description: The metre per second is a unit of both speed and velocity in the International System of Units (SI). It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one metre in one second of time.

UNITS.name: meter per second scaler 256
UNITS.description: This is the same as the meter per second (above) only scaled by 1/256, ie: VALUE / 256.

UNITS.name: meter per minute, meters per minute
UNITS.description: The metre per minute is a unit of both speed and velocity in the metric system. It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one metre in one minute of time.

UNITS.name: kilometer/hour, kilometers/hour, kilometers per hour, kph
UNITS.description: The kilometer per hour is a unit of both speed and velocity in the metric system. It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one kilometer in one minute of time.

UNITS.name: feet/second
UNITS.description: The feet/second is a unit of both speed and velocity in the imperial system. It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one foot in one second of time.

UNITS.name: feet/minute, ft/min
UNITS.description: The feet/minute is a unit of both speed and velocity in the imperial system. It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one foot in one minute of time.

UNITS.name: mile per hour, miles per hour, mph
UNITS.description: The mile per hour is a unit of both speed and velocity in the imperial system. It is equal to the speed of a body covering a distance of one mile in one hour of time.

UNITS.name: knot, knots
UNITS.description: The knot is a unit of of both speed and velocity equal to one nautical mile per hour, which is 1.852kph using the metric scale and approximately 1.15078mph using the imperial scale.

UNITS.name: knot scaler 128
UNITS.description: This is the same as the knot (above) only scaled by 1/128, ie: VALUE / 128.

UNITS.name: mach, machs
UNITS.description: A mach number is a unit of of both speed and velocity based on an aircraft's speed relative to the speed of sound. An aircraft travelling at mach 1 is equivalent to 1234.8kph or 767.27mph.

UNITS.name: mach 3d2 over 64k
UNITS.description: THis usnit will scale the mach value using the following formula: VALUE * (3.2 / 65536.0).

UNITS.name: meter per second squared, meters per second squared
UNITS.description: The metre per second squared is the unit of acceleration in the International System of Units (SI). It is equal to the increase in speed in meters per second for every second that passes.

UNITS.name: feet per second squared, foot per second squared
UNITS.description: The foot per second squared is the unit of acceleration in the imperial system. It is equal to the increase in speed in feet per second for every second that passes.

UNITS.name: Gforce, G Force
UNITS.description: The g-force is a measurement of the type of force per unit mass - typically acceleration - that causes a perception of weight. A g-force of 1g is equal to the conventional value of gravitational acceleration on Earth - about 9.8 meters per second squared, or 32.174 feet per second squared.

UNITS.name: G Force 624 scaled
UNITS.description: This is the same as the G Force unit, only scaled by 624 using the forumla: VALUE / 624

UNITS.name: second, seconds
UNITS.description: The second is the base unit of time in the International System of Units (SI), defined as 1⁄86400 of a day, or more accurately as being equal to the time duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the fundamental unperturbed ground-state of the caesium-133 atom.

UNITS.name: minute, minutes
UNITS.description: The minute is a unit of time equal to 1⁄60 of an hour, or 60 seconds. Although not an SI unit, the minute is accepted for use with SI units.

UNITS.name: hour, hours
UNITS.description: The hour is a unit of time in the International System of Units (SI), defined as 1⁄24 of a day, or more accurately as 3,600 atomic seconds.

UNITS.name: day, days
UNITS.description: The day is a unit of time equal to 24 hour. Although not an SI unit, the day is accepted for use with SI units, and is equal to 86,400 seconds.

UNITS.name: hour over 10, hours over 10
UNITS.description: This is a unit of time equal to 1⁄10 of an hour, or 360 seconds.

UNITS.name: year, years
UNITS.description: The year is a unit of time in the International System of Units (SI), defined as 3645.25 days of exactly 86,400 seconds, totalling exactly 31,557,600 seconds.

UNITS.name: Watt, Watts
UNITS.description: The watt is a unit of power in the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as a 1 joule per second.

UNITS.name: ft lb per second
UNITS.description: Foot pounds per second are a unit of power using the imperial system. It is the energy transferred upon applying a force of 1 pound-force through a linear displacement of 1 foot over the time of 1 second.

UNITS.name: meter cubed per second, meters cubed per second
UNITS.description: A cubic metre per second is a derived International System (SI) unit of volumetric flow rate equal to that of a cube of matter with sides of one metre in length exchanged or moving each second.

UNITS.name: liter per hour, liters per hour
UNITS.description: This is a non-SI unit of volumetric flow rate, defined as the rate at which one liter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one hour. 1 liter per hour is equivalent to 0.264172 gallons per hour.

UNITS.name: gallon per hour, gallons per hour, gph
UNITS.description: This is an imperial unit of volumetric flow rate, defined as the rate at which one gallon of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one hour. 1 gallon per hour is equivalent to 3.785411784 liters per hour.

UNITS.name: kilogram, kilograms, kg
UNITS.description: The kilogram is the base unit of mass in the International System of Units (SI). The kilogram is defined in terms of the second and the metre, based on fixed fundamental constants of nature. It is equivalent to 2.20462 pounds.

UNITS.name: pound, pounds, lbs
UNITS.description: The pound is a unit of mass in the imperial system. It is equivalent to 0.453592kilos.

UNITS.name: pound scaler 256
UNITS.description: This is the same as the pound (above) only scaled by 1/256, ie: VALUE / 256.

UNITS.name: slug, slugs, geepound, geepounds
UNITS.description: The slug is a unit of mass in the imperial system. A slug is defined as the mass that is accelerated by 1 foot per second when a net force of one pound is exerted on it. 1 slug is a mass equal to 32.1740 pounds or 14.59390 kilograms (based on standard gravity).

UNITS.name: kilogram per second, kilograms per second
UNITS.description: This is a unit of mass flow rate in the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as the mass of matter equal to one kilogram which crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one second.

UNITS.name: pound per hour, pounds per hour
UNITS.description: This is a unit of mass flow rate in the imperial system. It is defined as the mass of matter equal to one pound which crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one hour.

UNITS.name: ampere, amperes, amp, amps
UNITS.description: The ampere is the base unit of electric current in the International System of Units (SI). A current of one ampere is one coulomb of charge going past a given point per second.

UNITS.name: fs7 charging amps
UNITS.description: This is the same as the amp unit, only scaled using the following formula: VALUE * (50.0 / 65535.0).

UNITS.name: volt, volts
UNITS.description: The volt is the derived unit for electric potential, electric potential difference (voltage), and electromotive force. It is the potential difference between two points that will impart one joule of energy per coulomb of charge that passes through it, and can be expressed in terms of SI base units.

UNITS.name: Hertz, Hz,
UNITS.description: The hertz is the derived unit of frequency in the International System of Units (SI) and is defined as one cycle per second.

UNITS.name: Kilohertz, KHz
UNITS.description: This is a measure of frequency equivalent to 1,000 cycles per second (103 hertz).

UNITS.name: Megahertz, MHz
UNITS.description: This is a measure of frequency equivalent to 1,000,000 cycles per second (106 hertz).

UNITS.name: Frequency BCD16
UNITS.description: This is a definition of a frequency using a 16bit binary coded decimal.

UNITS.name: Frequency BCD32
UNITS.description: This is a definition of a frequency using a 32bit binary coded decimal.

UNITS.name: Frequency ADF BCD32
UNITS.description: This is a definition of an ADF frequency using a 32bit binary coded decimal.

UNITS.name: kilogram per cubic meter, kilograms per cubic meter
UNITS.description: The kilogram per cubic metre is an SI derived unit of density. It is defined by mass in kilograms divided by volume in cubic metres. It is equivalent to 0.00194032 slug per cubic foot, or 0.0083454 pounds per gallon.

UNITS.name: Slug per cubic feet, Slugs per cubic feet, Slug/ft3, slug per cubic foot, slugsper cubic foot
UNITS.description: The slug per cubic foot is an imperial unit of density. It is defined by the mass of a slug divided by volume in cubic feet. It is equivalent to 515.379 kilograms per cubic meter, or 4.30104 pounds per gallon.

UNITS.name: pound per gallon, pounds per gallon, lbs/gallon
UNITS.description: The pound per gallon is an imperial unit of density. It is defined by the mass of a pound divided by volume in gallons. It is equivalent to 119.826 kilograms per cubic meter, or 0.232502 slug per cubic feet.

UNITS.name: pascal, pascals, Pa
UNITS.description: The pascal is the SI derived unit of pressure used to quantify internal pressure. The unit, is defined as one newton per square meter.

UNITS.name: kilopascal, kpa
UNITS.description: This is a measure of pressure equivalent to 1,000 pascal (103 pascal).

UNITS.name: millimeter of mercury, millimeters of mercury, mmHg
UNITS.description: A millimeter of mercury is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of mercury one millimeter high under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 133.322 pascals, or 0.019337psi.

UNITS.name: centimeter of mercury, centimeters of mercury, cmHg
UNITS.description: A centimeter of mercury is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of mercury one centimeter high under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 1333.223 pascals, or 0.193367psi.

UNITS.name: inch of mercury, inches of mercury, inHg
UNITS.description: An inch of mercury is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of mercury one centimeter high under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 3386.39 pascals, or 0.491154psi.

UNITS.name: inHg 64 over 64k
UNITS.description: This unit is for inches of mercury, only the value has been scaled using the following formula: (64.0 / 65536.0) * VALUE. Generally only required for describing units of manifold pressure.

UNITS.name: millimeter of water, millimeters of water
UNITS.description: A millimeter of water is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of water 1 mm high with a density of 1 gram per cubic centimeter, under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 9.80638 pascals, or 0.0014223psi.

UNITS.name: Newton per square meter, newtons per square meter
UNITS.description: Newtons per square meter is a unit that shows how the pascal unit is derived from other SI units. 1 newton per square meter equals 1 pascal.

UNITS.name: kilogram force per square centimeter, KgFSqCm
UNITS.description: Kilogram force per square centimeter is a unit of pressure which is not a part of the International System of Units (SI). It is equivalent to 98066.5 pascals, or 14.2233psi.

UNITS.name: kilogram meter squared, kilograms meter squared
UNITS.description: Kilograms per square meter is a unit of measurement of surface density. It is equivalent to 9.80665 pascals, or 0.001423psi.

UNITS.name: atmosphere, atmospheres, atm
UNITS.description: The atmosphere is a unit of pressure defined as approximately equal to Earth's atmospheric pressure at sea level. It is equivalent to 101325 pascals, or 14.6959psi.

UNITS.name: bar, bars
UNITS.description: The bar is a metric unit of pressure, but not part of the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as exactly equal to 100,000 pascals, equivalent to 14.50378psi.

UNITS.name: millibar, millibars, mbar, mbars, hectopascal, hectopascals
UNITS.description: The millibar is a metric unit of pressure, but not part of the International System of Units (SI). It is defined as exactly equal to 1000 pascals, equivalent to 0.0145psi.

UNITS.name: millibar scaler 16
UNITS.description: This unit is the same as the millibar (above), only scaled by a factor of 1/16, ie: VALUE / 16;

UNITS.name: pound-force per square inch, psi
UNITS.description: The pound-force per square inch is an imperial unit of pressure. It is equivalent to 6894.76 pascals.

UNITS.name: psi scaler 16k
UNITS.description: This is the psi value scaled by 16K, using the formula: VALUE / 16384.0

UNITS.name: psi 4 over 16k
UNITS.description: This is the psi value scaled using the formula: (4 / 16384.0) * VALUE

UNITS.name: psi fs7 oil pressure
UNITS.description: This is the psi value scaled using the formula: (55.0 / 16384) * VALUE. Only usually used when dealing with engine oil pressure.

UNITS.name: pound-force per square foot, psf
UNITS.description: The pound-force per square foot is an imperial unit of pressure. It is equivalent to 47.8803 pascals.

UNITS.name: psf scaler 16k
UNITS.description: This is the psf value scaled by 16K, using the formula: VALUE / 16384.0

UNITS.name: slug feet squared, slugs feet squared
UNITS.description: The slug square foot is a unit of moment of inertia in imperial units. It is equivalent to 32.17405 pound foot squared, or 1.35582 Kilogram Square Meters.

UNITS.name: boost cmHg
UNITS.description: A centimeter of mercury is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of mercury one centimeter high under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 1333.223 pascals, or 0.193367psi. This unit is used when defining the boost provided by superchargers or turbochargers on equipped planes.

UNITS.name: boost inHg
UNITS.description: An inch of mercury is a unit of pressure. It is defined as the extra pressure generated by a column of mercury one centimeter high under the force of 1 gravity. It is equivalent to 3386.39 pascals, or 0.491154psi. This unit is used when defining the boost provided by superchargers or turbochargers on equipped planes.

UNITS.name: boost psi
UNITS.description: The pound-force per square inch is an imperial unit of pressure. It is equivalent to 6894.76 pascals. This unit is used when defining the boost provided by superchargers or turbochargers on equipped planes.

UNITS.name: Newton meter, Newton, meters, nm
UNITS.description: The newton meter is a unit of torque in the International System of Units (SI). One newton-metre is equal to the torque resulting from a force of one newton applied perpendicularly to the end of a moment arm that is one metre long.

UNITS.name: foot-pound, foot pound, ft-lbs, foot-pounds
UNITS.description: The foot-pound is a unit of energy in the imperial unit of measure. It is the energy transferred upon applying a force of one pound-force through a linear displacement of one foot. The corresponding SI unit is the joule.

UNITS.name: lbf-feet
UNITS.description: A pound-foot is a unit of torque representing one pound of force acting at a perpendicular distance of one foot from a pivot point. Conversely one pound-foot is the moment about an axis that applies one pound-force at a radius of one foot.

UNITS.name: kilogram meter, kilogram meters, kgf meter, kgf meters
UNITS.description: A kilogram-force meter is an International System of Units (SI) unit of torque representing one kilogram-force applied perpendicularly to a one-meter long moment arm.

UNITS.name: poundal feet
UNITS.description: One poundal is the force that accelerates a mass of 1 pound at a rate of one foot per second per second. So a poundal foot is a unit of torque representing one poundal of force acting at a perpendicular distance of one foot from a pivot point.

UNITS.name: FractionalLatLonDigits
UNITS.description: The number of fractional lat / lon digits.

UNITS.name: part
UNITS.description: This is a base unit that will be used to make conversions when using other units in RPN and SimVar calculations.

UNITS.name: half, halfs
UNITS.description: The input will be halved.

UNITS.name: third, thirds
UNITS.description: The input will be divided by 3.

UNITS.name: percent, percentage
UNITS.description: Normally a value between 0 and 100, though sometimes values outside this range are possible (reverse thrust, for example).

UNITS.name: percent over 100
UNITS.description: Normally a value between 0.0 and 1.0, though sometimes values outside this range are possible (reverse thrust, for example).

UNITS.name: percent scaler 16k
UNITS.description: This is a precentage value scaled by 16K, using the formula: VALUE / 16384.0

UNITS.name: percent scaler 32k
UNITS.description: This is a precentage value scaled by 32K, using the formula: VALUE / 32767.0

UNITS.name: percent scaler 2pow23
UNITS.description: This is a precentage value scaled by 223, using the formula: VALUE / 8388608.0

UNITS.name: bel, bels
UNITS.description: The bel is a unit used in the comparison of power levels in electrical communication or of intensities of sound, corresponding to an intensity ratio of 10 to 1.

UNITS.name: decibel, decibels
UNITS.description: The decibel is a relative unit of measurement equal to one tenth of a bel.

UNITS.name: more_than_a_half
UNITS.description: The input will be converted to either 0 (if it is less than a half of the "part" base value) or 1 (if it is more than half of the "part" base value)

UNITS.name: times
UNITS.description: The input value is a multiplier.

UNITS.name: ratio
UNITS.description: The input value is expected to be a ratio.

UNITS.name: number, numbers
UNITS.description: The input value is expected to be any real number.

UNITS.name: scaler
UNITS.description: The input value is expected to be a scaler.

UNITS.name: position, position 16K, position 32K, position 128
UNITS.description: The input value will be converted to an integer position value either using the "part" base scale, or as a 16 bit or 32bit integer, or as an integer between 0 and 128.

UNITS.name: Enum
UNITS.description: A positive or negative integer corresponding to the member of the enum

UNITS.name: Bool, Boolean
UNITS.description: The only reliable numeric equivalent is that 0 is returned for False. Non-zero values, especially both 1 and -1, are used to indicate True.

UNITS.name: Bco16
UNITS.description: This unit requires a four digit octal number, and is usually only used for transponder codes.

UNITS.name: mask
UNITS.description: This indicates that the value is a bitmask where one or more bits in the value will be true/false, and each bit will represent a specific item.

UNITS.name: flags
UNITS.description: This indicates a selection of one or more flag values combined into a single value.

UNITS.name: string
UNITS.description: This unit expects some kind of string input.

UNITS.name: per radian
UNITS.description: The input is value that will be a ratio "per radian".

UNITS.name: per degree
UNITS.description: The input is value that will be a ratio "per degree".

UNITS.name: keyframe
UNITS.description: The input is for an animation keyframe and will be divided by 200.

UNITS.name: XYZ
UNITS.description:
This unit signifies a 3 value struct with the values (all 32bit floats):
          
            
              x - a value representing an X position
            
            
              y - a value representing an Y position
            
            
              z - a value representing an Z position
            
          
          This struct unit is required by the following SimVars:
          
            STRUCT_BODY_ROTATION_ACCELERATION  
            STRUCT_BODY_ROTATION_VELOCITY  
            STRUCT_BODY_VELOCITY
            STRUCT_ENGINE_POSITION
            STRUCT_EYEPOINT_DYNAMIC_ANGLE
            STRUCT_EYEPOINT_DYNAMIC_OFFSET
            STRUCT_SURFACE_RELATIVE_VELOCITY
            STRUCT_WORLDVELOCITY
            STRUCT_WORLD_ACCELERATION
            STRUCT_WORLD_ROTATION_VELOCITY

UNITS.name: PBH
UNITS.description:
This unit signifies a 3 value struct with the values (all 32bit integers):
          
            pitch - the pitch value
            bank - the bank value
            heading - the heading value
          
          This struct unit is required by the following SimVars:
          
            LANDING_LIGHT_PBH
            STRUCT_PBH32

UNITS.name: latlonaltpbh
UNITS.description:
This unit signifies a 6 value struct with the values:
          
            lat - a latitude, expressed as a 64bit integer where the first 16bits are padding, the next 32bits are the integer value and the last 16bits are the fraction.
            lon - a longitude, expressed as 64bit integer where the lower 16bits are the fractional part, the upper 32 bits are the integer part and the rest is padding.
            alt - an alttude, expressed as a 64bit integer where the first 16bits are padding, the next 32bits are the integer value and the last 16bits are the fraction.
            pitch - the pitch value, expressed as 32bit integer
            bank - the bank value, expressed as 32bit integer
            heading - the heading value, expressed as 32bit integer
          
          This struct unit is required by the following SimVars:
          
            STRUCT_LATLONALTPBH

UNITS.name: latlonalt
UNITS.description:
This unit signifies a 6 value struct with the values:
          
            lat - a latitude, expressed as a 64bit integer where the first 16bits are padding, the next 32bits are the integer value and the last 16bits are the fraction.
            lon - a longitude, expressed as 64bit integer where the lower 16bits are the fractional part, the upper 32 bits are the integer part and the rest is padding.
            alt - an alttude, expressed as a 64bit integer where the first 16bits are padding, the next 32bits are the integer value and the last 16bits are the fraction.
          
          This struct unit is required by the following SimVars:
          
            ADF LATLONALT
            INNER_MARKER_LATLONALT
            MIDDLE_MARKER_LATLONALT
            NAV_DME_LATLONALT
            NAV_GS_LATLONALT
            NAV_VOR_LATLONALT
            OUTER_MARKER_LATLONALT
            STRUCT_LATLONALT

UNITS.name: PID_STRUCT
UNITS.description:
This unit signifies a 7 value struct containing PID controller state with the values (all 64bit floats):
          
            pid_p - the proportional value
            pid_i - the first integral value
            pid_i2 - the second integral value
            pid_d - the proportional value
            i_boundary - the first integral boundary value
            i2_boundary - the second integral boundary value
            d_boundary - the derivative boundary value
          
          This struct is returned by the following SimVars:
          
            STRUC_AIRSPEED_HOLD_PID_CONSTS
            STRUC_HEADING_HOLD_PID_CONSTS

UNITS.name: POIList
UNITS.description: This unit signifies that the returned value is an array of POI data. This unit is only used within the JS for HTML gauges.

UNITS.name: GlassCockpitSettings
UNITS.description:
This unit is only used when retrieving the cockpit struct within the JS for HTML gauges.
          For the contents of this struct, please see the section on the Glass Cockpit Settings Struct.

UNITS.name: FuelLevels
UNITS.description:
This unit is for retrieving the fuel levels of all tanks and will return a struct containing the following values (all 32bit floats):
          
            Center
            LeftMain
            RightMain
            LeftAux
            RightAux
            LeftTip
            RightTip
            Center2
            Center3
            External1
            External2
